rule_text_one: allocationtransferagencyidentifier, agencyidentifier, beginningperiodofavailability, endingperiodofavailability, availabilitytypecode, mainaccountcode, subaccountcode
rule_text_two: allocation_transfer_agency, agency_identifier, beginning_period_of_availability, ending_period_of_availability, availability_type_code, main_account_code, sub_account_code
description: TAS fields must match CARS file
Must have either a piid, fain, or uri
ObligationsUndeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (FYB) = USSGL(4801 + 4831 + 4871 + 4881). This applies to the award level.
ObligationsDeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (FYB) = USSGL(4901 + 4931 + 4971 + 4981). This applies to the award level.
GrossOutlayAmountByAward (FYB) = GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB) + GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB)
GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB) = USSGL(4802 + 4832 + 4872+ 4882). This applies to the award level.
GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB) = USSGL(4902 + 4908 + 4972 + 4982). This applies to the award level.
ObligationsUndeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (CPE) = USSGL(4801 + 4831 + 4871 + 4881). This applies to the award level.
ObligationsDeliveredOrdersUnpaidTotal (CPE) = USSGL(4901 + 4931 + 4971 + 4981). This applies to the award level.
GrossOutlayAmountByAward (CPE) = GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (FYB) + GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (FYB)
GrossOutlaysUndeliveredOrdersPrepaidTotal (CPE) = USSGL(4802 + 4832 + 4872+ 4882). This applies to the award level.
GrossOutlaysDeliveredOrdersPaidTotal (CPE) = USSGL(4902 + 4908 + 4972 + 4982). This applies to the award level.
Required on rows that do not include values for USSGL accounts balances or subtotals
Negate rule C17C
True if at least one of the USSGL fields is populated
Check that this is a valid agency code
Check that this is a valid agency code
FYB fields are required if reporting period end date is within Q1

Must be valid 3-digit object class as defined in OMB Circular A-11 Section 83.6, or a 4-digit code which includes a 1-digit prefix that distinguishes direct, reimbursable, and allocation obligations. Do not include decimal points when reporting in the Schema.

Reimbursable flag indicator is required when reporting obligation or outlay USSGL account balances (excluding downward adjustments SGL accounts). Valid values are "R" for "ReimbursableFundingSource" and "D" for "DirectFundingSource".
True if at least one of these fields is populated, used to make ByDirectReimbursableFundingSource required
Checks if object class is 4 digits, if so will check consistency with direct reimbursable flag
Check that 1 digit prefix is consistent with value for ByDirectReimbursableFundingSource
If object class is 4 digits, check that 1 digit prefix is consistent with value for ByDirectReimbursableFundingSource
DeobligationsRecoveriesRefundsOfPriorYearByAward_CPE = USSGL(4871+ 4872 + 4971 + 4972). This applies to the award level.
Must be a valid program activity name and code for the corresponding TAS/TAFS as defined in Section 82 of OMB Circular A-11.
